repnme.cdata!:
Cape Verde - Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project (FY05) : seventh quality at entry assessment
            (QEA7) - fiscal year 2004-2005

abstracts.cdata!:
The panel rates the First Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit (PRSC-1) to Cape Verde highly
            satisfactory overall together with its assessment dimensions
            of strategic relevance and approach; poverty, gender and
            social development; fiduciary aspects; implementation
            arrangements; and bank inputs and processes.  The
            structural, financial and macroeconomic aspects; policy and
            institutional aspects; and the risk assessment dimensions
            are rated satisfactory. This PRSC which became effective in
            April 2005 is a response to the Government's request
            for the external partners to align with national strategies
            and systems for poverty reduction, as agreed at the
            donor's roundtable meeting in Praia, Cape Verde's
            capital, in April 2003.  The objective of the credit is to
            support the implementation of the Growth and Poverty
            Reduction Strategy Paper (GPRSP).  It is a one-tranche
            operation, the first of a planned series of three annual
            programmatic single-tranche operations.  The financial
            support provided through the PRSC will narrow the gap
            between the cost of implementing key elements of the GPRSP
            and resources available from the government's own
            domestic revenues and other donor support.  A policy
            dialogue and results-based framework under PRSC-1 is to
            focus on the following pillars of the GPRSP: (a) promoting
            good governance; (b) developing human capital in education
            and health sectors; and (c) improving the effectiveness and
            sustainability of the social protection system.

repnme.cdata!:
Cape Verde - First Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit

abstracts.cdata!:
The Proposed First Poverty Reduction
            support Credit aims at supporting the Government to (a) meet
            the objectives of its Growth and Poverty Reduction Strategy
            Paper (GPRSP); and (b) improve the efficiency, effectiveness
            and transparency of the national budget process as the
            central mechanism for channeling resources toward poverty
            reduction. The proposed Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) would engage the Bank in policy and technical
            dialogue in three of the five pillars of the GPRSP, based on
            division of labor with other IDA and donor projects and
            comparative advantage of the PRSC: (a) Promote good
            governance, reinforcing effectiveness and guaranteeing
            equity - centered on reforms in public expenditure
            management, civil service, the judiciary and
            decentralization; (b) Develop and enhance human capital,
            with a focus on health and education; and (c) Strengthen the
            effectiveness and sustainability of the social protection system.
